body:
**Is this a request for help?** (If yes, you should use our troubleshooting guide and community support channels, see http://kubernetes.io/docs/troubleshooting/.): No

**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?** (If you have found any duplicates, you should instead reply there.): openstack port

---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one): BUG REPORT

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`): v1.5.1


**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: Openstack
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Fedora 24
- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.9.12-100.fc24.x86_64
- **Install tools**:
- **Others**:


**What happened**: When creating a LoadBalancer Service with the Openstack cloud provider, Kubernetes created a Neutron load balancer and floating IP correctly, but assigned the floating ip to an unrelated Nova server instead of assigning it to the load balancer.


**What you expected to happen**: The floating IP should have been associated with the load balancer


**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible): Create two different private networks using 10.0.0.0/24. Create a nova server on network 1 with IP 10.0.0.10. Run Kubernetes on network 2. Create a LoadBalancer Service in Kubernetes with the VIP 10.0.0.10. The floating IP will potentially get assigned to the nova server on network 1 instead of the load balancer on network 2.


**Anything else we need to know**: This appears to be happening because `getPortByIP` does not filter IPs by network (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/c077c30/pkg/cloudprovider/providers/openstack/openstack_loadbalancer.go#L82-L108). The result is that a matching IP from an unrelated network may be found when looking for the port for the load balancer by IP (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/c077c30/pkg/cloudprovider/providers/openstack/openstack_loadbalancer.go#L831-L844).

title: Openstack LoadBalancer Service can potentially assign floating ip to unrelated resource instead of Neutron load balancer
